column1: At the Thanksgiving sociable some one had observed her turquoise engagement ring
column2: —some one who said that such a hand was worthy of a diamond
column3: that turquoises were a pretty color
column4: but that there was only one stone for an engagement ring
column5: and that was a diamond. At the Christmas dance the same some one had said that her waltzing would make her "all the rage" in Boston. She wondered if it were true
column7: if she had not promised to marry Stephen
column8: some splendid being from a city would have descended from his heights
column9: bearing diamonds in his hand. Not that she would have accepted them; she only wondered. These disloyal thoughts came seldom
column10: and she put them resolutely away
column11: devoting herself with all the greater assiduity to her muslin curtains and ruffled pillow-shams. Stephen
column13: had his momentary pangs. There were times when he could calm his doubts only by working on the little house. The mere sight of the beloved floors and walls and ceilings comforted his heart
